content.rendered:
[vc_row css_animation= » » row_type= »row » use_row_as_full_screen_section= »no » type= »grid » angled_section= »no » text_align= »left » background_image_as_pattern= »without_pattern » css= ».vc_custom_1563963327442{padding-top: 50px !important;} » z_index= » »][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Observatory

[/vc_column_text][vc_separator type= »small » position= »center » color= »#00a0e3″]

THE ECONOMIC CONSEQUENCES OF THE HEALTH CRISIS IN FRANCE

The economic consequences of the health crisis on the French population are dramatic, with an estimated one million people having fallen below the poverty line in 2020....

28 décembre, 2021

AN INTOLERABLE INCREASE IN EARLY CHILDHOOD POVERTY AS A RESULT OF THE HEALTH CRISIS

Break Poverty’s study on early childhood poverty and food aid, which surveyed around 100 parents with children aged 0-3 receiving food support, paints an alarming picture of poverty among young children in France, its impact on family stress and its exponential rise due to the Covid-19 crisis....

28 décembre, 2021

DIGITAL ILLITERACY, A PHENOMENON THAT AFFECTS THE MOST VULNERABLE

Digital skills are essential for citizens to be fully integrated in today’s society. Most administrative formalities are carried out online, whether it’s completing a tax return, looking for work or creating a business. But what about those on the other side of the digital divide?...

28 décembre, 2021

Children facing precarity: the numbers

The young are the first victims of poverty. In France, a child out of five lives in precarious environments. In the world, 50% of the children are very poor....

09 août, 2019

Delving into school drop-outs

Despite the improvement in the past 10 years, much has yet to be done, especially when looking at a school’s role in providing equal opportunities to all....

09 août, 2019

Poverty rates in France

The most exposed or at risk of poverty are the youth, single-parent families, the unemployed, and the urban population....

05 juillet, 2019

Articles and Books :

[/vc_column_text][vc_separator type= »normal » color= »#c1c1c1″ down= »45″][vc_row_inner row_type= »row » type= »full_width » text_align= »left » css_animation= » » css= ».vc_custom_1536843853228{padding-bottom: 20px !important;} »][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

Chômage, précarité : halte aux idées reçues. (Unemployment, precarity: ending pre-conceived ideas)

Jean François Yon (2016) Les Editions de l’Atelier

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

En finir avec les idées fausses sur les pauvres et la pauvreté. (Ending false ideas about poor people and poverty)

ATD Quart Monde (2016) Editions Quart Monde

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

La précarité. (Precarity)

Patrick Cingolani (2017) Que sais-je ?

[/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner row_type= »row » type= »full_width » text_align= »left » css_animation= » » css= ».vc_custom_1536843856377{padding-bottom: 20px !important;} »][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

Repenser la pauvreté. (Re-thinking poverty)

Abhijit V. Banerjee et Esther Duflo (2011) Editions Seuil

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

Les inégalités sociales. (Social inequalities)

Nicolas Duvoux (2017) Que sais-je ?

[/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width= »1/3″]

Eradiquer la misère, démocratie, mondialisation et droits de l’homme. (Eradicating poverty, democracy, globalisation and human rights)

Xavier Godinot (2008) PUF
